results.title: Instrument
results.brief_description:
Jem Cohen is a New York-based producer working in 16mm and 8mm film and video. His poetic, often ephemeral, work is marked by a blurring of the distinctions between documentary, narrative, and experimental genres. Cohen frequently shoots in hundreds of locations without any additional crew, in the tradition of documentary street photographers such as Robert Frank. His projects include collaborations with poets, writers, and bands such as R.E.M. and Fugazi, creating alternatives to generic and commodified ‘music video.’
‘Instrument’ is a collaboration between Jem Cohen and the Washington DC band Fugazi, the project covers the ten year period from the bands inception in 1987. Far from a traditional documentary, the project is a musical document: a portrait of musicians at work.

results.title: Instructing the worker on the job
results.brief_description: A new female employee is told to do a job on the drill press; she is unable to do the job and is then shown how to do it; this does not have the desired effect and in distress she leaves the machine; the supervisor then takes more care over instructing the next young woman assigned to operate the machine, and she becomes a competent operator. Thus are the differences between telling, showing, and instructing demonstrated.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Barbara Boyle, Michael Taylor, Richard Lerner, Brian Doubleday, Christina Steinberg and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: This psychological thriller is about an anthropologist, Ethan Powell, who leaves human society to live among gorillas. Fully ensconced in this animal world, Powell is extradited back to the United States after murdering two gorilla poachers. Once there, it falls to an ambitious psychiatrist to discover the non-communicative Powell’s secrets. With in-form performances by Anthony Hopkins and Cuba Gooding Jr, this film attempts with profundity to address human nature, harmony with the natural world, and what motivates passions bordering on insanity. Cast also includes Donald Sutherland.

results.title: Instant arson: testing firebombs and incendiaries
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of arson with firebombs and chemical incendiaries as ignition sources, and demonstrates different methods of extinguishing the resulting fire.

results.title: Installing trim
results.brief_description: Carpenter Craig Savage considers that trimwork, being the most visible part of your house, should get the attention they deserve. As he trims out parts of a house, his step-by-step instructions and trade secrets will guide you on how to achieve professional results. Included in this video are demonstrations on how to make a tight butt, miter or cope joint, negotiate unsquare openings, seat mouldings solidly against bumpy walls and ceilings, extend window and door jambs and fit casing around doors and windows.

results.title: Installing doors and windows
results.brief_description: Carpenter Tom Law demonstrates his methods for installing doors and windows using easy to follow techniques and hints that he has developed over 26 years. You will be instructed on the installation of various doors and windows, each requiring different skills that you will build on and develop with each application. Among the skills are squaring and securing an opening window, building and installing a jamb, hanging and adjusting a door.

results.title: Inspector Gadget. Travel trouble
results.brief_description: Inspector Gadget, Penny and Brain travel far and wide to fight the agents of MAD. Inspector Gadget takes risks as well as photgraphs on a trip to Africa. He also investigates a mountain top weather change in Tibet. Episode titles: Photo safari; Weather in Tibet
